channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chopped up Christmas tree still present on Edinburgh Place, 26th January
item.description:
The community action team from Cheltenham Borough homes. I’ve chopped the tree up as requested but nobody has come to take it away yet. Perhaps the parks team the green spaces team could pick it up?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 54 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Potholes, 25th January
item.description:
About 30m stretch of road with MULTIPLE potholes (A few attached in images). Road is cracked in places, overall difficult stretch to drive down as potholes on both sides of single track lane. Can see where previous potholes have been filled in (been an issue for many years), and where road is sinking it causes it to wear away. Overall, needs resurfacing to stop more every winter & stop people having flat tyres!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Claydon Farm Cottage Claydon Lane, Claydon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs on the road are completely worn, 25th January
item.description:
The yellow hatched box and the arrows/signs for what lane to be in for the roundabout are barely visible to the point you can hardly tell the hatched box is there so people are waiting in it and cars cannot get out of smyths.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 593 Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes & road falling apart, 25th January
item.description:
Road is STILL in very poor condition despite recent reports. I have just spent £200 on new tyres, can I ask you to do the same on the roads please.

item.title: V large pothole, 25th January

item.title: Pavement collapsing around BT chamber, 25th January
item.description:
Queens Road, Cheltenham - between entrances to no. 18 and The Folly. Large crack in tarmac pavement and subsided pavement surface around BT inspection chamber in pavement. First noticed before Christmas, has got a lot worse in past week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 big pot holes in close succession, 24th January

item.title: Crossing not working, 24th January
item.description:
